--- title: "Hands-on Exercise 4" author: "Chang Fang Yu" date-modified: "last-modified" execute: echo: True eval: True warning: false freeze: true --- # Visualising Distribution ## Getting Started ### Installing and loading the packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(ggdist, ggridges, ggthemes, colorspace, tidyverse) ``` ::: ### Data import ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv") ``` ::: ## Visualising Distribution with Ridgeline Plot ### Plotting ridgeline graph: ggridges method ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = CLASS)) + geom_density_ridges( scale = 3, rel_min_height = 0.01, bandwidth = 3.4, fill = lighten("#7097BB", .3), color = "white" ) + scale_x_continuous( name = "English grades", expand = c(0, 0) ) + scale_y_discrete(name = NULL, expand = expansion(add = c(0.2, 2.6))) + theme_ridges() ``` ::: ::: ### Varying fill colors along the x axis ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = CLASS, fill = stat(x))) + geom_density_ridges_gradient( scale = 3, rel_min_height = 0.01) + scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Temp. [F]", option = "C") + scale_x_continuous( name = "English grades", expand = c(0, 0) ) + scale_y_discrete(name = NULL, expand = expansion(add = c(0.2, 2.6))) + theme_ridges() ``` ::: ::: ### Mapping the probabilities directly onto colour ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = CLASS, fill = 0.5 - abs(0.5-stat(ecdf)))) + stat_density_ridges(geom = "density_ridges_gradient", calc_ecdf = TRUE) + scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Tail probability", direction = -1) + theme_ridges() ``` ::: ::: ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = CLASS, fill = factor(stat(quantile)) )) + stat_density_ridges( geom = "density_ridges_gradient", calc_ecdf = TRUE, quantiles = 4, quantile_lines = TRUE) + scale_fill_viridis_d(name = "Quartiles") + theme_ridges() ``` ::: ::: ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = ENGLISH, y = CLASS, fill = factor(stat(quantile)) )) + stat_density_ridges( geom = "density_ridges_gradient", calc_ecdf = TRUE, quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975) ) + scale_fill_manual( name = "Probability", values = c("#FF0000A0", "#A0A0A0A0", "#0000FFA0"), labels = c("(0, 0.025]", "(0.025, 0.975]", "(0.975, 1]") ) + theme_ridges() ``` ::: ::: ## Visualising Distribution with Raincloud Plot ### Plotting a Half Eye graph ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = RACE, y = ENGLISH)) + stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5, justification = -0.2, .width = 0, point_colour = NA) ``` ::: ::: ### Adding the boxplot with geom_boxplot() ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = RACE, y = ENGLISH)) + stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5, justification = -0.2, .width = 0, point_colour = NA) + geom_boxplot(width = .20, outlier.shape = NA) ``` ::: ::: ### Adding the Dot Plots with stat_dots() ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = RACE, y = ENGLISH)) + stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5, justification = -0.2, .width = 0, point_colour = NA) + geom_boxplot(width = .20, outlier.shape = NA) + stat_dots(side = "left", justification = 1.2, binwidth = .5, dotsize = 2) ``` ::: ::: ### Finishing touch ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(exam, aes(x = RACE, y = ENGLISH)) + stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5, justification = -0.2, .width = 0, point_colour = NA) + geom_boxplot(width = .20, outlier.shape = NA) + stat_dots(side = "left", justification = 1.2, binwidth = .5, dotsize = 1.5) + coord_flip() + theme_economist() ``` ::: ::: # Visual Statistical Analysis with ggstatsplot ## Getting Started ### Installing and launching R packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(ggstatsplot, tidyverse, qqplotr) ``` ::: ### Importing data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv") ``` ::: ## One-sample test: gghistostats() method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(1234) gghistostats( data = exam, x = ENGLISH, type = "bayes", test.value = 60, xlab = "English scores" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Two-sample mean test: ggbetweenstats() ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggbetweenstats( data = exam, x = GENDER, y = MATHS, type = "np", messages = FALSE ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Oneway ANOVA Test: ggbetweenstats() method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggbetweenstats( data = exam, x = RACE, y = ENGLISH, type = "p", mean.ci = TRUE, pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, pairwise.display = "s", p.adjust.method = "fdr", messages = FALSE ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Significant Test of Correlation: ggscatterstats() ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggscatterstats( data = exam, x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH, marginal = FALSE, ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Significant Test of Association (Depedence) : ggbarstats() methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam1 <- exam %>% mutate(MATHS_bins = cut(MATHS, breaks = c(0,60,75,85,100)) ) ggbarstats(exam1, x = MATHS_bins, y = GENDER) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-27-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: # Visualising Models ## Getting Started ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(readxl, performance, parameters, see) ``` ::: ### Importing Excel file: readxl methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} car_resale <- read_xls("data/ToyotaCorolla.xls", "data") car_resale ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1,436 × 38 Id Model Price Age_08_04 Mfg_Month Mfg_Year KM Quarterly_Tax Weight 1 81 TOYOTA … 18950 25 8 2002 20019 100 1180 2 1 TOYOTA … 13500 23 10 2002 46986 210 1165 3 2 TOYOTA … 13750 23 10 2002 72937 210 1165 4 3  TOYOTA… 13950 24 9 2002 41711 210 1165 5 4 TOYOTA … 14950 26 7 2002 48000 210 1165 6 5 TOYOTA … 13750 30 3 2002 38500 210 1170 7 6 TOYOTA … 12950 32 1 2002 61000 210 1170 8 7  TOYOTA… 16900 27 6 2002 94612 210 1245 9 8 TOYOTA … 18600 30 3 2002 75889 210 1245 10 44 TOYOTA … 16950 27 6 2002 110404 234 1255 # ℹ 1,426 more rows # ℹ 29 more variables: Guarantee_Period , HP_Bin , CC_bin , # Doors , Gears , Cylinders , Fuel_Type , Color , # Met_Color , Automatic , Mfr_Guarantee , # BOVAG_Guarantee , ABS , Airbag_1 , Airbag_2 , # Airco , Automatic_airco , Boardcomputer , CD_Player , # Central_Lock , Powered_Windows , Power_Steering , … ``` ::: ::: ### Multiple Regression Model using lm() ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale) model ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale) Coefficients: (Intercept) Age_08_04 Mfg_Year KM -2.637e+06 -1.409e+01 1.315e+03 -2.323e-02 Weight Guarantee_Period 1.903e+01 2.770e+01 ``` ::: ::: ### Model Diagnostic: checking for multicolinearity: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_collinearity(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Check for Multicollinearity Low Correlation Term VIF VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI KM 1.46 [ 1.37, 1.57] 1.21 0.68 [0.64, 0.73] Weight 1.41 [ 1.32, 1.51] 1.19 0.71 [0.66, 0.76] Guarantee_Period 1.04 [ 1.01, 1.17] 1.02 0.97 [0.86, 0.99] High Correlation Term VIF VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI Age_08_04 31.07 [28.08, 34.38] 5.57 0.03 [0.03, 0.04] Mfg_Year 31.16 [28.16, 34.48] 5.58 0.03 [0.03, 0.04] ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} check_c <- check_collinearity(model) plot(check_c) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-31-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Model Diagnostic: checking normality assumption ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model1 <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale) check_n <- check_normality(model1) plot(check_n) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-32-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Model Diagnostic: Check model for homogeneity of variances ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_h <- check_heteroscedasticity(model1) plot(check_h) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-33-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Model Diagnostic: Complete check ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_model(model1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-34-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Visualising Regression Parameters: see methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(parameters(model1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-35-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Visualising Regression Parameters: ggcoefstats() methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggcoefstats(model1, output = "plot") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-36-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: # Visualising Uncertainty ## Getting Started ### Installing and loading the packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(plotly, crosstalk, DT, ggdist, ggridges, colorspace, gganimate, tidyverse) ``` ::: ### Data import ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv") ``` ::: ## Visualizing the uncertainty of point estimates: ggplot2 methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} my_sum <- exam %>% group_by(RACE) %>% summarise( n=n(), mean=mean(MATHS), sd=sd(MATHS) ) %>% mutate(se=sd/sqrt(n-1)) ``` ::: ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
RACE n mean sd se
Chinese 193 76.50777 15.69040 1.132357
Indian 12 60.66667 23.35237 7.041005
Malay 108 57.44444 21.13478 2.043177
Others 9 69.66667 10.72381 3.791438
````` ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(head(my_sum), format = 'html') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
RACE n mean sd se
Chinese 193 76.50777 15.69040 1.132357
Indian 12 60.66667 23.35237 7.041005
Malay 108 57.44444 21.13478 2.043177
Others 9 69.66667 10.72381 3.791438
````` ::: ::: ::: ### Plotting standard error bars of point estimates ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-42-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(my_sum) + geom_errorbar( aes(x=RACE, ymin=mean-se, ymax=mean+se), width=0.2, colour="black", alpha=0.9, linewidth=0.5) + geom_point(aes (x=RACE, y=mean), stat="identity", color="red", size = 1.5, alpha=1) + ggtitle("Standard error of mean maths score by rac") ``` ::: ::: ### Plotting confidence interval of point estimates ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-44-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(my_sum) + geom_errorbar( aes(x=reorder(RACE, -mean), ymin=mean-1.96*se, ymax=mean+1.96*se), width=0.2, colour="black", alpha=0.9, linewidth=0.5) + geom_point(aes (x=RACE, y=mean), stat="identity", color="red", size = 1.5, alpha=1) + labs(x = "Maths score", title = "95% confidence interval of mean maths score by race") ``` ::: ::: ### Visualizing the uncertainty of point estimates with interactive error bars ::: panel-tabset ### The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### The code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} shared_df = SharedData$new(my_sum) bscols(widths = c(4,8), ggplotly((ggplot(shared_df) + geom_errorbar(aes( x=reorder(RACE, -mean), ymin=mean-2.58*se, ymax=mean+2.58*se), width=0.2, colour="black", alpha=0.9, size=0.5) + geom_point(aes( x=RACE, y=mean, text = paste("Race:", `RACE`, "
N:", `n`, "
Avg. Scores:", round(mean, digits = 2), "
95% CI:[", round((mean-2.58*se), digits = 2), ",", round((mean+2.58*se), digits = 2),"]")), stat="identity", color="red", size = 1.5, alpha=1) + xlab("Race") + ylab("Average Scores") + theme_minimal() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text( angle = 45, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1)) + ggtitle("99% Confidence interval of average /
maths scores by race")), tooltip = "text"), DT::datatable(shared_df, rownames = FALSE, class="compact", width="100%", options = list(pageLength = 10, scrollX=T), colnames = c("No. of pupils", "Avg Scores", "Std Dev", "Std Error")) %>% formatRound(columns=c('mean', 'sd', 'se'), digits=2)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ## Visualising Uncertainty: ggdist package ### Visualizing the uncertainty of point estimates: ggdist methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam %>% ggplot(aes(x = RACE, y = MATHS)) + stat_pointinterval() + labs( title = "Visualising confidence intervals of mean math score", subtitle = "Mean Point + Multiple-interval plot") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-48-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam %>% ggplot(aes(x = RACE, y = MATHS)) + stat_pointinterval(.width = 0.95, .point = median, .interval = qi) + labs( title = "Visualising confidence intervals of median math score", subtitle = "Median Point + Multiple-interval plot") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-49-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Visualizing the uncertainty of point estimates: ggdist methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam %>% ggplot(aes(x = RACE, y = MATHS)) + stat_pointinterval( show.legend = FALSE) + labs( title = "Visualising confidence intervals of mean math score", subtitle = "Mean Point + Multiple-interval plot") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-50-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Visualizing the uncertainty of point estimates: ggdist methods ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} exam %>% ggplot(aes(x = RACE, y = MATHS)) + stat_gradientinterval( fill = "skyblue", show.legend = TRUE ) + labs( title = "Visualising confidence intervals of mean math score", subtitle = "Gradient + interval plot") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-51-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Visualising Uncertainty with Hypothetical Outcome Plots (HOPs) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} devtools::install_github("wilkelab/ungeviz") ``` ::: ## Visualising Uncertainty with Hypothetical Outcome Plots (HOPs) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(123) summary_data <- exam %>% group_by(RACE) %>% summarize(yintercept = mean(MATHS)) ggplot(data = exam, aes(x = factor(RACE), y = MATHS)) + geom_point(position = position_jitter(height = 0.3, width = 0.05), size = 0.4, color = "#0072B2", alpha = 1/2) + geom_hline(data = summary_data, aes(yintercept = yintercept, group = RACE), color = "#D55E00", size = 1) + theme_bw() + transition_states(RACE, transition_length = 1, state_length = 3) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-53-1.gif) ::: :::
